channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Black bags dumped AGAIN, 19th November
item.description:
Everyday this happens. Black bags then get are gone through and rubbish is all over the road starting from Tigella.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Mission Place, Peckham, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: At the corner of Honiton Rd NW6 6QD and Hartland NW6 6BG, 19th November
item.description:
Lots of wet leaves on double yellow and in street gutters preventing proper rainwater drainage and causing a puddle. Would you please kindly sweep / remove those leaves that are turning into compost as those are accumulated leaves and not from recent leaf fall. It would be much appreciated, thanks.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Honiton Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: NOT FIXED, streets are full of black bags and another waste like always, has not been cleared from weekend, 19th November

item.title: Fly tipping of bin, 19th November
item.description:
A bin has been fly-tipped outside of no.43. This was raised earlier in the week then marked as resolved, however the bin is still there. Please remove

item.title: Nw6 6qd Honiton Rd in front of 17 to 35, 19th November
item.description:
Wet leaves - would you please kindly sweep thoroughly as pavement gets slippery when wet. Thanks. Please note plane trees were pollarded 2 weeks ago therefore there should now not be any leaves in street gutters nor on the pavement in front of those houses.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Honiton Road, London

item.title: Outside 2 and 4 park village east, 19th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Park Village East, Chalk Farm, Camden Town, London Borough of Camden

item.title: Overgrown tree causing blind spot on bend, 19th November
item.description:
Overgrown tree on green opposite 101 Tillingbourne Green is causing a blind spot on the bend and needs pruning back. Has recently caused a driver to hit my parked car. Speed limit signs should be introduced and reduced also.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 105, Tillingbourne Green, Poverest, Orpington, London Borough of Bromley

item.title: On the Raydon Street pavement next to Three Point Park, 19th November
item.description:

item.title: Communal bin Lindon Grove, 19th November
